message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: Iterator<TopEnemy> iterator = newTopEnemy.iterator();
while (iterator.hasNext()) {
    TopEnemy i = iterator.next();
    for (int q = 0; q < ammo.length; q++) {
        float xsubs = i.enemyX - ammo[q].positionX;
        float ysubs = i.enemyY - ammo[q].positionY;
        float squared = (xsubs * xsubs) + (ysubs * ysubs);
        float distance = (float)Math.sqrt(squared);
        if (distance < 10.0) {
            iterator.remove();
            break;
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: You should use an Iterator to safely remove items from a list during iteration. The Iterator's remove method removes the last element returned by the iterator. It is the only safe way to modify a collection during iteration. The break statement is used to stop the inner loop once an enemy is removed, as the ammo that hit it is no longer relevant.
